abstract: National College Athletic Assn president Mark Emmert announces his support of a proposal that would allow conferences to increase grants to athletes by about $2,000; critics argue that the change would escalate the financial disparity in college sports, where there is already a great divide between larger and smaller conferences.
snippet: Mark Emmert said he supported a proposal that would let conferences increase grants to athletes by about $2,000, a move that critics say would escalate the financial disparity in college sports.
lead_paragraph: Mark Emmert said he supported a proposal that would let conferences increase grants to athletes by about $2,000, a move that critics say would escalate the financial disparity in college sports.

headline.main: Bigger Grants for Athletes Are Discussed
headline.print_headline: Bigger Grants For Athletes Are Discussed
headline.seo: N.C.A.A. President Favors Bigger Grants for Athletes
